title: Hour-Specific Risk for Neonatal Hyperbilirubinemia
desc: The Hour-Specific Risk for Neonatal Hyperbilirubinemia predicts risk of hyperbilirubinemia in newborns based on total serum bilirubin (TSB) measurement.

orgreference.text: Bhutani VK, Johnson L, Sivieri EM. Predictive ability of a predischarge hour-specific serum bilirubin for subsequent significant hyperbilirubinemia in healthy term and near-term newborns. Pediatrics. 1999;103(1):6-14.

other_refer.text: Newman TB, Xiong B, Gonzales VM, Escobar GJ. Prediction and prevention of extreme neonatal hyperbilirubinemia in a mature health maintenance organization. Arch Pediatr Adolesc Med. 2000;154(11):1140-7.

data.evidence:
Nomogram for risk of hyperbilirubinemia:

Nomogram from AAP guidelines (Figure 2).

For exact values (starting at 18 hours old), refer to Table 1 in Stevenson 2001.

 

Nomogram for phototherapy:

Nomogram from AAP guidelines (Figure 3).

inputs.name: age
inputs.tips_en: Use in newborns 12-168 hours of age

inputs.name: gest
inputs.tips_en: Optional, for phototherapy recommendations based on AAP guidelines

inputs.name: factor
inputs.tips_en: Isoimmune hemolytic disease, G6PD deficiency, asphyxia, significant lethargy, temperature instability, sepsis, acidosis, or albumin <3.0 g/dL (30 g/L)
